instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2610: What is 820-2610? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.5V_S0: What is 5V_S0? 5V_S5 is an abbreviation for ‚ÄúPP5V_S0‚Äù.
definitions.C7771: What is C7771? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2330 and 820-2532 logic boards that often dies and causes PP1V05_S5_MCP or PP1V05_S5 to be 0.331v instead of 1.05v. If heating this cap restores voltage to this rail, replace.

threads.title: a1279  <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2610</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
hi have i have 1 problem i don't have <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> 
sometimes it turns on the mac fans are too strong when the meto the card in the mac nothing starts. example on <CAPACITOR>C7560</CAPACITOR> and always present 8v

threads.title: a1279  <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2610</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
a1279  <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2610</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
[QUOTE="tili1988, post: 82675, member: 28606"]
who generates the <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>
[/QUOTE]
This voltage comes from <CHIP>U7500</CHIP> controller, =<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0_REG</SIGNAL> voltage rails (L7510 inductor). Check LDO output (pin 7) , EN1 enable input (pin 14), VBST1 voltage (pin 17) and VIN (pin 6). Do you have any voltage to ground on =<SIGNAL>PPMCPCORE_S0_REG</SIGNAL> (L7560 inductor) at the same time? What is the resistance to ground on L7510?

threads.title: a1279  <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2610</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Please, use a better translator.
I don't exactly understand your first post.

I recommend you to start changing <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR>.
You can find lot of information about its failure on Internet and this forum.

When the machine turns on, do you get video, or USB activity?
If fans spin to max then, which other voltages (apart of <SIGNAL>5V_S0</SIGNAL>) do you get on the board?
Check all big coils at that time.

Remove charger and allow 15s to discharge any remanent voltage.
Then check the resistance to ground at L6995.
Use ohm scale, not diode mode; should be higher than 30K.
